position.marginalia_text: Dexteritate, et Industria: Industra, et dexteritate.

marginalia.translation: With skillfullness and industry, with industry and skillfullness.

position.marginalia_text: Eccè quotidiè splendidissimu[m] Encomium Simonis Onia[e] apud Sapientissimum Syracidem. Et quotidiè illustrius efflorescat Chrysotechnus. Tam amabili discretione gratiosus, quàm inclyta magnificentia conspicuus. Aurea Simonis Euschemosyne: sed Charitum candore perfusa. Nec odiosè superba: nec abiectè blanda: sed amabiliter gratiosa.

marginalia.translation: Here today is the most splendid encomium of Simon, son of Onia, found in the wisest Sirach. And today let the illustrious Chrysotechnus bloom, as agreeable to pleasant distinction, as he is notable for glorious magnificence. The golden refinement of Simon, imbued with the radiance of the Graces. And he is not distastefully arrogant nor cheaply alluring, but pleasantly agreeable.

position.marginalia_text: Neminem vult inimicu[m], quem habere potest amicum. Cauet autem vtrunq[ue]: Sed quasi neutru[m].

marginalia.translation: He wants no one as an enemy whom he can have as a friend. Moreover, he guards against both friends and enemies, as if they were neither.

position.marginalia_text: Prudentis est, de se loqui humillimè: sua agere altissimè.
lowlie in terms: high in acts.

marginalia.translation: The prudent man speaks most humbly about himself and performs his deeds most highly.

position.marginalia_text: Priùs egit, quàm dixit, qui profundus est pragmaticus: et omnes metuit ante, neminem post.

marginalia.translation: He who is profoundly pragmatic acted first then spoke. And he feared all who came before him and no one who came after him.

position.marginalia_text: Eutrapelus est omnis homo: vt quondam Proteus.

marginalia.translation: Eutrapelus is every man, as if he were Proteus.
